lead_paragraph: An article on Wednesday about the rough debut for Charlie Zink, a rookie knuckleball pitcher for the Boston Red Sox, misspelled the surname of a knuckleballer from the 1930s and ’40s, when such pitchers were not as rare. He was Johnny Niggeling, not Niggling. (The error also appeared in an article in March 1984 about a catcher who played with Niggeling. That mistake was discovered during research for this correction.).
